question_sentence: How many members of the US National Guard were deployed in Washington D.C. for Joe Biden’s inauguration?
Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was arrested at a Moscow airport this week after spending five months where recovering from a poison attack?
How many people tested positive for Covid antibodies in the UK in December, according to newly released Office for National Statistics data?
How many Beijing residents have been banned from leaving the Chinese capital in a partial lockdown introduced this week to contain fresh Covid outbreaks?
Donald Trump broke with tradition by ending his reign as US leader where rather than attending his successor’s inauguration?
choices: His Turnberry golf resort in Scotland
His Trump International Hotel in Las Vegas
His Trump Tower penthouse apartment in New York

question_sentence: Incest allegations against which French public intellectual have inspired thousands to share testimonies of their abuse on Twitter with the hashtag #Metooinceste?
The UK is hoping to match Israel’s speedy vaccination process by taking a maximum average of how many minutes to administer the jab to each patient?
A bust of Winston Churchill removed from the Oval Office by Joe Biden was first gifted to which US president?
A shop in Michigan is giving what for free to customers who prove they have received their Covid jab?
Which of the following rappers was pardoned by Donald Trump in the final hours of his presidency?
Joe Biden was sworn into office on Wednesday, making him which president in American history?
evidence: Upon inauguration, Biden became the 46th President of the United States. Vice President Kamala Harris was also sworn in as the 49th vice president, making her the first Black woman and person of South Asian descent to hold the position.

question_sentence: As one of his first moves as President, Joe Biden issued an executive order to dissolve a presidential commission established during the Trump Administration. What was the commission called?
evidence: Biden rescinded the 1776 commission established under President Trump. The commission released a report this past Monday on Martin Luther King Jr. Day that many considered inflammatory, racially charged and a counter against the New York Times’ 1619 Project, which looks at the history of slavery.

question_sentence: Just prior to Biden’s inauguration, the Department of State declared that Uyghur Muslims and other minority groups were falling victim to systematic genocide. What country was directly blamed for these crimes against humanity?
evidence: Former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo declared in a statement that China was committing the atrocities. “This genocide is ongoing, and…we are witnessing the systematic attempt to destroy Uyghurs by the Chinese party-state,” Pompeo said.

question_sentence: Jay Y. Lee was sentenced to prison for bribery and embezzlement. At which company was Lee vice chairman and heir to its fortune?
evidence: Lee is the vice chairman to Korean tech company Samsung and heir to its fortune. He was sentenced to 2 ½ years behind bars as part of the latest twist to a plot that brought down former South Korean President Park Geun-hye.

question_sentence: The Museum of London is now displaying a giant blimp that has been flown over London and other various cities protesting visits by former President Trump. What does the blimp depict Trump as being?
evidence: The blimp depicts Trump’s likeness as a giant 20-foot-tall baby, referred to around the world as the “Trump Baby”. It will be featured in the museum alongside other pieces of public protests in the British capital.

question_sentence: This week, Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny and his organization released a large scale investigation into President Vladimir Putin’s wealth, including allegations about a secretive, high-dollar property they say the President owns. What is the property?
evidence: The estate is estimated to be worth around $1.4 billion, and the report details convoluted and corrupt ways they say Putin has financed the property and his general wealth.

question_sentence: The Switzerland-based Independent Panel for Pandemic Preparedness and Response determined that China and which diplomatic body acted too slowly to contain the coronavirus?
evidence: The independent panel determined that China and the World Health Organization (WHO) acted too slowly in combating the spread of the coronavirus, cases of which were first reported in December 2019 but serious action not taken until mid-January of 2020.

question_sentence: Citing the global computer chip manufacturing slowdown, which car company is halting production for one month at its Saarlouis, Germany plant?
evidence: Ford is halting production at the German plant until February 19. The plant employs 5,000 workers, producing the Focus, Ford’s most popular car in Europe.

question_sentence: Applications are out to be part of a “Hotdogger” team driving the world-famous Wienermobile across the United States for an entire year. Which company sponsors the beloved hot dog bus?
evidence: Oscar Mayer is the name behind the famous 27-foot Wienermobile. Chosen Hotdoggers will cross the country and attend more than 200 events according to the job posting.

question_sentence: New England Patriots veteran Tom Brady led his new team to defeat the New Orleans Saints and bring them to the NFC Championship. What team does he now play for?
evidence: Brady now plays for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, a team that last reached the Super Bowl in 2003. The NFC Championship game will be Brady’s ninth championship game in 10 seasons.
